workflow.name: Personalize client meeting prep with GPT-4, Google Calendar, Notion & Places API to Slack
workflow.description:
Who is this for
This template is perfect for sales professionals, account managers, and business development teams who want to make memorable impressions on their clients. It automates the tedious task of researching gift shops and preparation spots before important meetings.
What it does
This workflow automatically prepares personalized recommendations for client visits by monitoring your Google Calendar, enriching data from Notion, and using AI to select the perfect options.
How it works

Trigger: Activates when a calendar event containing keywords like "visit," "meeting," "client," or "dinner" is created or updated
Extract: Parses company name from the event title
Enrich: Fetches customer preferences from your Notion database
Search: Google Places API finds nearby gift shops and quiet cafes
Analyze: GPT-4 recommends the best options based on customer preferences
Notify: Sends a personalized message to Slack with recommendations

Example Slack Output
Here's what the final notification looks like:
üéÅ Recommended Gift Shop
Patisserie Sadaharu AOKI (‚òÖ4.6)
3-5-2 Marunouchi, Chiyoda-ku
üí° Reason: The customer loves French desserts, so this patisserie's macarons would be perfect!

‚òï Pre-Meeting Cafe
Starbucks Reserve Roastery (‚òÖ4.5)
5 min walk from meeting location
Set up steps
Setup time: approximately 15 minutes

Google Calendar: Connect your Google Calendar account and select your calendar
Notion Database: Create a customer database with "Company Name" (title) and "Preferences" (text) fields
Google Places API: Get an API key from Google Cloud Console and add it to the Configuration node
OpenAI: Connect your OpenAI account for AI-powered recommendations
Slack: Connect your Slack workspace and update the channel ID in the final node

Requirements

Google Calendar account
Notion account with a customer database
Google Places API key (requires Google Cloud account)
OpenAI API key
Slack workspace with bot permissions

How to customize

Search radius: Adjust the searchRadius parameter in the Configuration node (default: 1000 meters)
Event keywords: Modify the Filter node conditions to match your calendar naming conventions
Notification channel: Change the Slack channel ID to your preferred channel

parameters.content:
##  Automate Personalized Gift & Cafe Recommendations with GPT-4, Google Calendar & Notion

**What this template does:**
Automatically suggests personalized gift shops and nearby cafes before your client visits, based on customer preferences stored in Notion.

**Who is this for:**
- Sales teams who want to make a great impression
- Account managers preparing for important client meetings
- Anyone who wants AI-powered meeting preparation

**How it works:**
1. Triggers when a calendar event containing "visit", "meeting", "client", or "dinner" is created/updated
2. Extracts the company name from the event title
3. Fetches customer preferences from Notion database
4. Searches nearby gift shops and cafes using Google Places API
5. Uses GPT-4 to recommend the best options based on customer preferences
6. Sends personalized recommendations to Slack

**Example Slack Output:**
```
 Recommended Gift Shop
Patisserie Sadaharu AOKI (‚òÖ4.6)
3-5-2 Marunouchi, Chiyoda-ku
üí° Reason: The customer loves French desserts, so this patisserie's macarons would be perfect!

‚òï Pre-Meeting Cafe
Starbucks Reserve Roastery (‚òÖ4.5)
5 min walk from meeting location
```

**Requirements:**
- Google Calendar account
- Notion database with customer preferences
- Google Places API key
- OpenAI API key
- Slack workspace

**Setup steps:**
1. Connect your Google Calendar credentials
2. Set up your Notion database with "Company Name" (title) and "Preferences" (text) fields
3. Add your Google Places API key in the Configuration node
4. Connect your OpenAI and Slack accounts
5. Update the Slack channel ID

### ‚öôÔ∏è Step 1: Configuration
Set your API keys and search parameters here.

**Important:** Replace the Google Places API key with your own.

- `googlePlacesApiKey`: Your API key
- `searchRadius`: Search radius in meters (default: 1000)
- `minRating`: Minimum rating filter (default: 4.5)

### üîç Step 2: Event Filtering
Filters calendar events to only process client visits and meetings.

**Keywords detected:**
- visit, meeting, client, dinner, greeting

Customize these keywords to match your calendar naming conventions.

### üìã Step 3: Data Enrichment
Extracts company name from event title and fetches customer preferences from Notion.

**Notion Database Setup:**
Create a database with these fields:
- `Company Name` (Title)
- `Preferences` (Text)

### üó∫Ô∏è Step 4: Location Search
Searches for gift shops and cafes near the meeting location using Google Places API.

**Gift Shops:** Bakeries, confectioneries
**Cafes:** Quiet work-friendly cafes

### ü§ñ Step 5: AI Recommendation
GPT-4 analyzes customer preferences and recommends:
- The best gift shop (with reasoning)
- The best cafe for pre-meeting preparation

The AI provides personalized explanations based on customer tastes.

### üì§ Step 6: Notification
Sends the personalized recommendation to your Slack channel.

**Setup:** Update the channel ID to your preferred channel.

values.content:
=You are a thoughtful and attentive sales assistant.
The user is about to attend an important client meeting. Based on the following information, create a Slack message recommending the best gift shop and cafe.

## Visit Information
- Client Company: {{ $('Extract Company Name').first().json.extractedCompany }}
- Customer Preferences: {{ $('Get Customer Preferences from Notion').item.json.properties['Preferences'].rich_text[0].plain_text }}

## Gift Shop Candidates (Google Maps Results)
{{ JSON.stringify($('Search Gift Shops').json) }}

## Cafe Candidates (Google Maps Results)
{{ JSON.stringify($('Search Nearby Cafes').json) }}

## Instructions
1. Analyze the customer preferences and select ONE gift shop that would delight them most.
2. Select ONE quiet cafe suitable for pre-meeting preparation.
3. Explain WHY you chose each place based on customer preferences.

## Output Format
No JSON needed. Output a friendly, readable message that can be posted directly to Slack.

Example format:
üéÅ **Recommended Gift Shop**
[Shop Name] (‚òÖRating)
[Address]
üí° Reason: Based on the customer's love for chocolate, this shop's award-winning truffles would be perfect!

‚òï **Pre-Meeting Cafe**
[Cafe Name] (‚òÖRating)
X minutes walk from meeting location

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
